New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers set a new record with a 10-0 start to the season, becoming the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games while scoring at least 110 points each time.
The Cavaliers scored 136 points in their 136-117 victory over the Golden State Warriors, tying the eighth largest halftime lead in NBA history with their 41-point halftime lead.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored a team-high 27 points and Evan Mobley added 23 points and 10 rebounds.
The Cavaliers utilized their depth with 10 players averaging at least 15 minutes per game, contributing to their fast-paced and effective play.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers head coach Kenny Atkinson's up-tempo style has been a great fit for the team, leading them to the league's best points per game (124.5) and a.526 field goal percentage.
Steve Kerr, former coach of the Golden State Warriors, praised the Cavaliers' continuity and fit under coach Atkinson.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson expressed pride in the team's effort and hunger after the victory.
Players like Jarrett Allen and Ty Jerome reflected on the team's potential and commitment to improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers outshot their opponents in each game but have struggled with rebounding and turnovers, committing 19 turnovers that led to 30 points for the Warriors.
Others: The game highlighted the Cavaliers' strong offensive play and defensive adjustments, showing their potential as a top-tier team in the league.
